avalancheActivity.highlights: The sometimes strong wind has transported only a little snow.
avalancheActivity.comment: Thus far the wind has been moderate to strong in the vicinity of peaks over a wide area. In the last few days the previously small wind slabs have increased in size moderately. The fresh wind slabs are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls and generally at high altitudes. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in west to north to southeast facing aspects above approximately 2200 m and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations. In some cases the various wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack. Hard wind slabs can be released by large loads at their margins in particular.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind was moderate to strong in the vicinity of peaks in some localities.
avalancheActivity.comment: Thus far the wind has been moderate to strong in the vicinity of peaks over a wide area. The fresh wind slabs are to be found in particular above approximately 2000 m. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in west to north to east facing aspects and in the vicinity of peaks. Hard wind slabs can only be released in isolated cases.

snowpackStructure.comment: As a consequence of the moderate to strong wind, fresh snow drift accumulations formed. The various wind slabs have bonded generally well with each other and the old snowpack. Hard wind slabs are in many cases shallow but to be assessed with care and prudence. Towards its surface, the snowpack is hard and its surface has a crust that is strong in many cases.
